definition: old style/old custom/a pre-Tang Dynasty genre of poetry aka 古體詩|古体诗[ɡu3 ti3 shi1]

sentences.english: The pavilion has an antiquated appearance.
Up to now, the local people still respect mother love of antiquity.
sentences.chinese: 至今，當地人民還保留着敬母愛母的古風。

sentences.english: Think less trendy, more vintage Hollywood glamour.
sentences.chinese: 少趕點時髦，來多點好萊塢優雅復古風。

sentences.english: The poet archaized her work with many Elizabethan words.
sentences.chinese: 詩人用許多伊麗莎白時代的詞語使她的作品有古風。

sentences.english: It was established by synoecism early in the Archaic period.
sentences.chinese: 它是在古風時代初期通過“居地統一”運動確立的。

sentences.english: TV's Sixties revival has also had an impact.
sentences.chinese: 電視上的六十年代復古風也有一定影響力。

sentences.english: The classic dishes birth of the old kitchen pot.
sentences.chinese: 火鍋的復古風催生了老竈火鍋。

sentences.english: The latest fashion is a revitalized style.
Jane Zhang said he was very much like the "fashionable retro style."
sentences.chinese: 張靚穎表示，自己非常喜歡這種“時尚復古風”。

sentences.english: His heroic swift and fierce dancing, soul sound of fear, with a heavy Yanzhao antiquity .
sentences.chinese: 其舞姿剽悍壯烈，聲懾魂魄，具有濃重的燕趙古風。

definition: abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
poetic essay/taxation/to bestow on/to endow with
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
to read aloud/to recite rhythmically/to chant/to intone (esp. poems in rhythm)
style (of art or literature)/form/one's work style/moral character
